Package org.opensextant.giscore.output.kml

Class KmzOutputStream

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.output.kml.KmzOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable, IGISOutputStream
public class KmzOutputStream extends Object implements IGISOutputStream
The kmz output stream creates a result KMZ file using the given output stream. It delegates the GIS output to a KmlOutputStream.

After all of the GIS objects have been written, additional zip entries can be added with the addEntry() methods.

TODO: Add special handling for the COLLADA models: ...

See also KmlWriter which wraps KmlOutputStream and handles KML or KMZ depending on file extension.

Author:
jgibson

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write(IGISObject object)
      Write the given object.
      Specified by:
      write in interface IGISOutputStream
      Parameters:
      object - the object to be written, never null.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the underlying stream has already been closed. (By adding additional file entries, for example).

    • setNumberCirclePoints

      public void setNumberCirclePoints(int circlePoints)
      Set number of points used to generate a circle. Defines how output will iterate over boundary points of Circle geometries at circlePoints resolution.
      Parameters:
      circlePoints - int number of points on boundary to use (1st is due South), should be greater than 0

    • close

      Specified by:

      Specified by:

      Throws:

    • closeWriter

      public void closeWriter() throws IOException
      Flush and close the KML file, but not the outputStream.
      This is useful if you want to write additional objects into the KMZ.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs
      See Also:
      • KmlOutputStream.closeWriter()

    • addEntry

      public OutputStream addEntry(String entryName) throws IOException
      Add a new entry to the KMZ file. As in any other zipfile, entry names must be unique.
      Parameters:
      entryName - the name of the entry to add
      Returns:
      An OutputStream to receive the entry data. Closing it will finish the current entry and will not close the underlying output stream.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error creating a new entry.

    • addEntry

      public void addEntry(InputStream source, String entryName) throws IOException
      Add a new entry to the KMZ file. As in any other zipfile, entry names must be unique.
      Parameters:
      source - the data to add to the KMZ file.
      entryName - the name of the entry to add
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error creating a new entry.
